original: prakaṭayatu naḥ śrīmāngaurīpatiḥ sa ṛtaṃ param ////
analyzed: prakaṭayatu naḥ śrīmān gaurīpatiḥ saḥ ṛtam param
translated: reveal to us the highest river of action, the ground for the manifestation of manifold states of being.

analyzed: yatra viśrāntim āsādya citram krīḍā vijṛmbhitam
translated: Where, having attained rest, the power of action displays its wonderful play,

analyzed: kriyāśaktiḥ iya atyantam darśayet tam stumaḥ śivam
translated: we praise that Śiva.

original: atha kriyāśaktisvarūpaṃ vitasya nirṇetum adhikārāntaram ārabhyate /
analyzed: atha kriyāśakti svarūpam vitasya nirṇetum adhikāra antaram ārabhyate
translated: Now, in order to determine the nature of the power of action, another section is begun.

analyzed: tatra śloka aṣṭakena
translated: There, with eight verses,

analyzed: atas eva
translated: for this very reason,

analyzed: ityādinā
translated: thus,

analyzed: yat avabhāsyate
translated: by which is manifested,

analyzed: ityantena parameśvare kriyā
translated: up to the end, in the Supreme Lord, action is ultimately without sequence, in reality.

analyzed: parimita sāṃsārika pramātṛ krama avabhāsana yogāt sa kramā api ca
translated: And it is also with sequence, due to the connection with the manifestation of the limited worldly knowers with sequence.

analyzed: iti upapādyate
translated: This is established.

analyzed: tathā hi ślokena ukta pūrvapakṣa pratikṣepaḥ
translated: Thus, with one verse, the previously stated counter-argument is rejected.
Then, with one verse, the distinction between having sequence and not having sequence is made.
Then, with three verses, the nature of sequence is determined.

analyzed: tatas śloka dvayena sakrama tva akrama tvayoḥ viṣaya vibhāgaḥ
translated: Then, with two verses, the division of the objects of having sequence and not having sequence is made.

original: viṣayavibhāge ca sati vastutaḥ ekatraiva tayoḥ viśrāntiḥ /
analyzed: viṣaya vibhāge ca sati vastutas ekatra eva tayoḥ viśrāntiḥ
translated: And when there is a division of objects, they both ultimately rest in one thing only.

analyzed: iti ślokena nirūpyate
translated: This is explained in one verse.

analyzed: iti tātparyam āhnikasya
translated: This is the purport of the chapter.

analyzed: atha śloka arthaḥ vibhajyate
translated: Now the meaning of the verse is analyzed.

original: tatra pūrvokte jñānaśaktisamarthanopayoganimeye siddhe prameyāntaramapi ayatnataḥ siddham /
analyzed: tatra pūrva ukte jñānaśakti samarthana upayoga nimeye siddhe prameya antaram api ayatnataḥ siddham
translated: There, when the previously stated topic useful for establishing the power of knowledge is established, another topic is also effortlessly established.

analyzed: iti adhikaraṇa siddhānta diśā darśayati
translated: Thus, in the direction of the conclusion of the section, it is shown

original: ata eva yadapyuktaṃ kriyā naikasya sakramā /
analyzed: atas eva yat api uktam kriyā nā ekasya sakramā
translated: For this very reason, what was said - that an action cannot belong to one thing successively,

analyzed: eka ityādi pratikṣiptam tad ekasya samarthanāt
translated: That is refuted by the establishment of one thing.

original: yat tāvat uktam jñānānyeva anubhavavikalparūpādibhinnāni na teṣām āśrayo 'sti kaścit /
analyzed: yat tāvat uktam jñānāni eva anubhava vikalpa rūpa ādi bhinnāni na teṣām āśrayaḥ sti kaścid
translated: As for what was said - that there are only cognitions distinguished as of the nature of experience, conception, etc., and they have no substratum at all,

original: saṃskārācca smṛtiḥ siddhā jñānaṃ ca jaḍaṃ cet na arthasya prakāśaḥ /
analyzed: saṃskārāt ca smṛtiḥ siddhā jñānam ca jaḍam ced na arthasya prakāśaḥ
translated: And that memory is established from impressions, and if cognition is inert, then there is no manifestation of the object,

original: ajaḍaṃ cet deśakālasaṃkocavaikalyāt ātmatattvāt abhinnam iti /
analyzed: ajaḍam ced deśa kāla saṃkoca vaikalyāt ātma tattvāt abhinnam iti
translated: And if it is not inert, then it is non-different from the true nature of the self due to the absence of restriction by space and time.

original: tat tāvat pratikṣiptaṃ bhinnānāmanubhavādīnāmanupapatteḥ vitatya darśitatvāt /
analyzed: tat tāvat pratikṣiptam bhinnānām anubhava ādīnām anupapatteḥ vitatya darśita tvāt
translated: That is refuted because the impossibility of the different experiences, etc. has been shown in detail.

analyzed: na ca saṃskāra mātrāt smṛtiḥ iti etat api uktam
translated: And it has also been said that memory is not just from impressions.

analyzed: ajaḍam eva ca asaṃkucita rūpam jñānam
translated: And knowledge is not dull, but has an uncontracted form.

original: tatsvātantryāvabhāsitajñeyoparāgavaśāt tu tasya saṃkocāvabhāsa ityapi darśitaṃ yataḥ /
analyzed: tad svātantrya avabhāsita jñeya uparāga vaśāt tu tasya saṃkoca avabhāsaḥ iti api darśitam yatas
translated: But it is also shown that the appearance of its contraction is due to the influence of the object of knowledge illuminated by its own freedom.

original: na kevalam ato hetukalāpāt jñānaśakticodyāni nidāritāni /
analyzed: na kevalam atas hetu kalāpāt jñāna śakti codyāni nidāritāni
translated: Not only are the objections regarding the power of knowledge refuted by this set of reasons,

original: yāvat kriyāśaktiviṣayāṇyapi dūṣaṇāni ata eva hetukalāpāt apasāritāni iti apiśabdaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat kriyā śakti viṣayāṇi api dūṣaṇāni atas eva hetu kalāpāt apasāritāni iti api śabdaḥ
translated: but also the objections regarding the sphere of the power of action are removed by this same set of reasons. This is the meaning of the word api (also).

original: ekā kriyā kramikā katham āśrayasya ekasvabhāvatve sati ghaṭate /
analyzed: ekā kriyā kramikā katham āśrayasya eka svabhāva tve sati ghaṭate
translated: How can one action be successive, if the substratum has a single nature?

analyzed: iti yuktam tathā
translated: This is reasonable. Thus,

analyzed: tatra tatra sthite
translated: situated there and there,

analyzed: iti
translated: etc.

analyzed: dviṣṭhasya aneka rūpa tvāt
translated: Since what is related to two has many forms,🔽etc.

analyzed: iti ca yat uktam tat api pratikṣiptam eva
translated: This is also refuted.

original: yataḥ iyati pūrvapakṣe iyadeva jīvitamekamanekasvabhāvaṃ kathaṃ syāt iti /
analyzed: yatas iyati pūrvapakṣe iyat eva jīvitam ekam aneka svabhāvam katham syāt iti
translated: Because in this prima facie view, the only life is this: how can the one have a manifold nature?

original: atra ca uktaṃ citsvabhāvasya darpaṇasyeva ekatānapabādhanena ābhāsabhedasaṃbhave ka iva dhirodha iti /
analyzed: atra ca uktam cit svabhāvasya darpaṇasya iva ekatā an apabādhanena ābhāsa bheda saṃbhave kaḥ iva dhirodhaḥ iti
translated: And here it is said: When the diversity of appearances is possible without negating the unity of the mirror, which has the nature of consciousness, what kind of contradiction is there?

original: tasmāt pratyabhijñānabalāt eko 'pi asau padārthātmā svabhāvabhedān viruddhān yāvat
analyzed: tasmāt pratyabhijñāna balāt ekaḥ pi asau padārtha ātmā svabhāva bhedān viruddhān yāvat
translated: Therefore, by the power of recognition, even that one entity, due to the difference in its nature, accepts as many contradictory [properties]

original: aṅgīkurute tāvat te virodhādeva kramarūpatayā nirbhāsamānāḥ tamekaṃ kriyāśrayaṃ saṃpādayanti iti /
analyzed: aṅgīkurute tāvat te virodhāt eva krama rūpa tayā nirbhāsamānāḥ tam ekam kriyā āśrayam saṃpādayanti iti
translated: as long as it accepts them. As long as it accepts them, they, appearing in the form of sequence due to contradiction itself, accomplish that one entity as the basis of action.

analyzed: tatas ca saṃbandha ādīnām api upapattiḥ iti
translated: And thus the establishment of the relation and so on is also justified.

analyzed: nanu ca kramika tvam eva kriyāyāḥ svarūpam
translated: But sequence itself is the nature of action.

analyzed: kramaḥ ca kāla kalanā hīne cit maye bhagavati nā asti
translated: And sequence does not exist in the Lord, who is consciousness and free from the conception of time.

analyzed: iti katham asya sā bhavet iti āśaṅkya āha
translated: How then can that be His? With this doubt in mind, he says

analyzed: sakrama tvam ca laukikyāḥ kriyāyāḥ kāla śaktitaḥ
translated: The sequentiality of worldly action is due to the power of time,

original: ghaṭate na tu śāśvatyāḥ prābhavyāḥ syātprabhor iva // / / //
analyzed: ghaṭate na tu śāśvatyāḥ prābhavyāḥ syāt prabhoḥ iva
translated: but not of the eternal, which would be like the Lord's.

original: utkṣipati apakṣipati hastam iti ye pūrvottare kṣaṇāḥ te kramavantaḥ /
analyzed: utkṣipati apakṣipati hastam iti ye pūrvottare kṣaṇāḥ te kramavantaḥ
translated: The moments before and after, such as he raises his hand and he lowers his hand, are sequential.

original: tatra yeṣāṃ ta eva kriyā kāṇādādīnāmiva teṣāṃ sā sakramā pratyakṣeṇaiva bhāti /
analyzed: tatra yeṣām te eva kriyā kāṇāda ādīnām iva teṣām sā sakramā pratyakṣeṇa eva bhāti
translated: Among them, for those who consider those very [moments] to be action, like the followers of Kaṇāda and others, that [action] appears with sequence even through direct perception.

original: ye tu manyante tathābhūtapratyakṣaparidṛśyamānarūpabhedasaṃpādikā yā asau kācit atīntriyā
analyzed: ye tu manyante tathābhūta pratyakṣa paridṛśyamāna rūpa bheda saṃpādikā yā asau kācid atīntriyā
translated: But those who think that some such [action] that accomplishes the difference in form that is directly perceived as such, which is beyond the present and future,

original: hastagatā śaktirvyāpārodbodharūpā nityānumeyā tasyāḥ kevalaṃ pūrvāparībhūtatvam anumīyate /
analyzed: hasta gatā śaktiḥ vyāpāra udbodha rūpā nitya anumeyā tasyāḥ kevalam pūrvāparībhūta tvam anumīyate
translated: The power that is present in the hand, which is of the nature of the arousal of activity, is always inferred. Only its sequential nature is inferred.

original: iti laukikyāḥ kriyāyāḥ sakramatvaṃ kālaśakteḥ ābhāsavicchedanapradarśanasāmārthyarūpāt pārameśvarāt śaktiviśeṣāt ghaṭate upapadyate /
analyzed: iti laukikyāḥ kriyāyāḥ sakrama tvam kāla śakteḥ ābhāsa vicchedana pradarśana sāmārthya rūpāt pārameśvarāt śakti viśeṣāt ghaṭate upapadyate
translated: Thus, the sequential nature of worldly action is established, i.e., is logically possible, from the special power of the Supreme Lord, which is of the nature of the ability to show the division of appearances, from the power of time.

original: yā tu prabhoḥ saṃbandhinī tadavyatiriktā kriyāśaktiḥ śāśvatī kālena aspṛṣṭā tasyāḥ sakramatvam asti iti saṃbhāvanā'pi nāsti /
analyzed: yā tu prabhoḥ saṃbandhinī tad avyatiriktā kriyāśaktiḥ śāśvatī kālena a spṛṣṭā tasyāḥ sakrama tvam asti iti saṃbhāvanā api na asti
translated: But the eternal power of action that belongs to the Lord, which is not separate from Him, is not even suspected to have a sequential nature.

original: yathā prabhoḥ sakramatvamasaṃbhāvyaṃ tathā asyā api / uktaṃ hi 🔽hastasya sakramatve tadgatā 'pi kriyā tathā syāt
analyzed: yathā prabhoḥ sakrama tvam asaṃbhāvyam tathā asyāḥ api uktam hi  hastasya sakrama tve tad gatā pi kriyā tathā syāt
translated: Just as the sequential nature of the Lord is impossible, so also of this [power]. For it is said:

analyzed: iti
translated: If the hand has a sequence, then the action present in it would also be like that.

original: nanu kālo viśeṣa bhāvam upagacchan bhāvaṃ svena rūpeṇa avacchinatti tatra ko'sau kālo nāma ityāśaṅkyāha
analyzed: nanu kālaḥ viśeṣa bhāvam upagacchan bhāvam svena rūpeṇa avacchinatti tatra kaḥ asau kālaḥ nāma iti āśaṅkya āha
translated: Now, when time assumes a particular form, it restricts the entity with its own form. What is this so-called time? Anticipating this doubt, he says:

analyzed: kālaḥ sūrya ādi saṃcāraḥ tad tad puṣpa ādi janma vā
translated: Time is the movement of the sun and so on, or the birth of this and that flower, etc.,

original: śītoṣṇe vātha tallakṣyaḥ krama eva sa tattvataḥ // / / //
analyzed: śīta uṣṇe vā atha tad lakṣyaḥ kramaḥ eva sa tattvataḥ
translated: Or cold and hot, or that which is characterized by them. In reality, it is just sequence.

analyzed: ye iyat tayā pariniṣṭhitāḥ ābhāsāḥ siddhāḥ
translated: Those appearances that are established by extent.

analyzed: tat yathā candra sūrya ādīnām sahakāra mallikā kuṭaja ādīnām śīta uṣṇa ādeḥ parabhṛta mada vilāsa ādeḥ
translated: For example, of the moon, sun, etc., of the jasmine, mallika, kutaja, etc., of cold, hot, etc., of the intoxication, sport, etc. of others,

original: ta eva kālaḥ yato'pariniṣṭhitaṃ gamanapaṭhanādi tairiyattayā pariniṣṭhīyate parivartakairiva kanakam /
analyzed: te eva kālaḥ yatas upari niṣṭhitam gamana paṭhana ādi taiḥ iyat tayā pariniṣṭhīyate parivartakaiḥ iva kanakam
translated: That itself is time, from which the impermanent motion, recitation, etc. are established by extent by them, like gold by the turning [processes].

original: sa eva ca sūryādīnāṃ svabhāvaviśeṣastattvataḥ paramāśrataḥ kramo nānyaḥ kaścit kramo nāma /
analyzed: saḥ eva ca sūrya ādīnām svabhāva viśeṣaḥ tattvataḥ parama āśrataḥ kramaḥ na anyaḥ kaścid kramaḥ nāma
translated: And that itself is the true, ultimate sequence of the nature of the sun, etc., not some other so-called sequence.

original: krama eva ca kālo nānyo'sau kaścit /
analyzed: kramaḥ eva ca kālaḥ na anyaḥ asau kaścid
translated: And sequence itself is time, not some other thing.

analyzed: iti eva kāraḥ bhinna abhinna kramaḥ yojyaḥ
translated: Thus, the word eva (only) should be connected as a different or non-different sequence.

analyzed: yaugapadyam api dvayoḥ ābhāsayoḥ apara ābhāsa apekṣayā kramaḥ eva
translated: Even simultaneity of two appearances is sequence in relation to another appearance.

analyzed: cira kṣipra ādi dhīḥ api vitata anya tva vaśāt ābhāsa bhede kramaḥ eva
translated: The cognition of long, short, etc. is also sequence in the difference of appearance due to the difference of extension.

analyzed: paratva aparatva buddhiḥ api sphuṭa tva ādinā tatra eva
translated: The cognition of far and near is also in that [sequence] itself due to clarity, etc.

original: iti tena tena pratimānavartakatulyena sūryasaṃcārādinā saha mīyamāno hemasthānīyo devadattābhāsasya vaicitryabheda ittham ucyate divasaṃ gacchati
analyzed: iti tena tena pratimāna vartaka tulyena sūrya saṃcāra ādinā saha mīyamānaḥ hema sthānīyaḥ devadatta ābhāsasya vaicitrya bhedaḥ ittham ucyate divasam gacchati
translated: Thus, the variety of the Devadatta-appearance, which is like gold, being measured along with the movement of the sun and so on, which serve as the standard measures in this way, is said to pass the day.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: nanu evaṃ kālo nāma bhāvasvabhāva eva astu /
analyzed: nanu evam kālaḥ nāma bhāva svabhāvaḥ eva astu
translated: Now, let time be just the intrinsic nature of an entity.

original: kā asau kālaśaktiḥ ityāśaṅkyāha 🔽kramo bhedāśrayo bhedo 'py ābhāsasadasattvataḥ /
analyzed: kā asau kāla śaktiḥ iti āśaṅkya āha  kramaḥ bheda āśrayaḥ ābhāsa sat asat tvataḥ
translated: What is this power of time? Anticipating this doubt, he says🔽Sequence is based on difference, and difference is due to the presence and absence of appearances.

analyzed: ābhāsa sat asat tve tu citra ābhāsa kṛtaḥ prabhoḥ
translated: But the presence and absence of appearances are due to the variety of appearances created by the Lord.

analyzed: iha svabhāva bheda mātram yadi krama ātmā kālaḥ
translated: Here, if time has the nature of sequence, which is merely the difference in intrinsic nature,

analyzed: tadā aṅgulī catuṣṭayam iti bhinna kālam bhavet
translated: then the set of four fingers would have a different intrinsic nature and would be of different times.

original: tasmāt aruṇābhāsasya sadbhāvaḥ sphuṭaprabhāpuñjasya ca asadbhāvaḥ ityevaṃbhūto yo bheda ābhāsasadbhāvāsadbhāvābhyanuprāṇitaḥ tatkṛtaḥ kramaḥ
analyzed: tasmāt aruṇa ābhāsasya sadbhāvaḥ sphuṭa prabhā puñjasya ca asadbhāvaḥ iti evaṃbhūtaḥ yaḥ bhedaḥ ābhāsa sadbhāva asadbhāva abhyanuprāṇitaḥ tad kṛtaḥ kramaḥ
translated: Therefore, the sequence that is created by the difference that occurs in this way, which is sustained by the presence and absence of appearances, namely, the presence of the red appearance and the absence of the mass of bright light,

analyzed: kāla ātmā
translated: is the nature of time.

original: tau ca ābhāsānāṃ bhāvābhāvau na bāhyahetukṛtau iti vistārya upapāditam /
analyzed: tau ca ābhāsānām bhāva abhāvau na bāhya hetu kṛtau iti vistārya upapāditam
translated: And it has been extensively argued that those presence and absence of appearances are not created by external causes.

original: iti ya eva saṃvitsvabhāva ātmā svaprasaṃkalpādau ābhāsavacitryanirmāṇe prabhuḥ prabhaviṣṇuḥ iti svasaṃviditastata eva tau bhavataḥ /
analyzed: iti yaḥ eva saṃvid svabhāvaḥ ātmā sva prasaṃkalpa ādau ābhāsa vacitrya nirmāṇe prabhuḥ prabhaviṣṇuḥ iti sva saṃviditaḥ tatas eva tau bhavataḥ
translated: Thus, he who is of the nature of consciousness, the Self, is the powerful one in the creation of the variegated appearances through his own imagination, etc. Thus, those two are known by himself alone.

original: sa hi ātmani nīlādīn ābhāsān ābhāsayan citratayā aparimeyayā bhāsayati /
analyzed: sa hi ātmani nīla ādīn ābhāsān ābhāsayan citra tayā aparimeyayā bhāsayati
translated: For he, illuminating the appearances such as blue, etc. in the Self, illuminates them in an immeasurable way.

original: tathāhi lohitābhāsaṃ ghaṭābhāsam unnatābhāsaṃ dṛḍhābhāsaṃ ca sāmānādhikaraṇyena ghaṭābhāsaṃ paṭābhāsaṃ ca pṛthaktvāvabhāsena anyonyatra
analyzed: tathā hi lohita ābhāsam ghaṭa ābhāsam unnata ābhāsam dṛḍha ābhāsam ca sāmānādhikaraṇyena ghaṭa ābhāsam paṭa ābhāsam ca pṛthaktva avabhāsena anyonyatra
translated: Thus, the appearance of a pot, the appearance of red, the appearance of height, and the appearance of solidity are illuminated as co-referential in the appearance of a pot. The appearance of a cloth and the appearance of a pot are separate due to the appearance of difference.

analyzed: ābhāsa abhāvena
translated: Due to the absence of appearances in each other.

analyzed: sva ātmani tu ekarasena ābhāsena
translated: But in the Self, they are illuminated as of one taste.

analyzed: iyati ca na kramasya udayaḥ
translated: And in this much, there is no arising of sequence.

original: yadā tu śaradābhāsaṃ hemantābhāsena ca sarvathaiva śūnyamābhāsayati hemantābhāsaṃ ca śāradābhāsena tadā kālātmā krama uttiṣṭhati /
analyzed: yadā tu śarad ābhāsam hemanta ābhāsena ca sarvathā eva śūnyam ābhāsayati hemanta ābhāsam ca śārada ābhāsena tadā kāla ātmā kramaḥ uttiṣṭhati
translated: But when he illuminates the appearance of autumn as completely empty with the appearance of winter, and the appearance of winter with the appearance of autumn, then the Self of time arises as sequence.

original: iti seyam itthaṃbhūtā bhāvavaicitryaprathanaśaktiḥ bhagavataḥ kālaśaktiḥ ityucyate ////
analyzed: iti sā iyam itthaṃbhūtā bhāva vaicitrya prathana śaktiḥ bhagavataḥ kālaśaktiḥ iti ucyate
translated: Thus, this power of the Lord, which is of such a nature and manifests the variety of existences, is called the power of time.

analyzed: citra ābhāsa kṛt tvam eva sphuṭayati
translated: He clarifies the fact of creating variegated appearances.

analyzed: mūrti vaicitryataḥ deśa kramam ābhāsayati asau
translated: By the diversity of forms, He manifests the sequence of space.
By the manifestation of the diversity of actions, the Lord also manifests the sequence of time.

analyzed: padārthasya svam rūpam mūrtiḥ
translated: The intrinsic nature of an object is its form.

original: tasyāḥ yat vaicitryaṃ vibhedaḥ /🔽tadyathā gṛhamiti anyat svarūpam /
analyzed: tasyāḥ yat vaicitryam vibhedaḥ  tat yathā gṛham iti anyat svarūpam
translated: Its diversity is its differentiation.🔽For example, the form of a house is one thing.

analyzed: prāṅgaṇam iti anyat  vipaṇiḥ iti anyat  devakulam iti aparam
translated: The form of a courtyard is another.🔽The form of a market is another.🔽The form of a temple is different.

analyzed: udyānam iti anyat
translated: The form of a garden is another.

analyzed: araṇyam iti tad anyatarat
translated: The form of a forest is different from those.

original: tasmāt vaicitryāt ābhāsyamānāt deśarūpo dūrādūravitatatvāvitatatvādiḥ kramo bhagavatā avabhāsyate /
analyzed: tasmāt vaicitryāt ābhāsyamānāt deśa rūpaḥ dūra adūra vitata tva avitata tva ādiḥ kramaḥ bhagavatā avabhāsyate
translated: From that diversity, which is being manifested, the Lord manifests the sequence in the form of space, such as far and near, extensive and non-extensive, etc.

original: yadā tu gāḍhapratyabhijñāprakāśabalāt tadeva idaṃ hastasvarūpam iti pratipattau mūrterna bhedaḥ /
analyzed: yadā tu gāḍha pratyabhijñā prakāśa balāt tat eva idam hasta svarūpam iti pratipattau mūrteḥ na bhedaḥ
translated: But when there is the cognition This is the same form of the hand due to the power of the light of intense recognition, there is no difference in form.

original: atha ca anyānyarūpatvaṃ bhāti tadaikasmin svarūpe yadanyat anyat rūpaṃ tadvirodhavaśāt asahabhavatkriyā ucyate /
analyzed: atha ca anya anya rūpa tvam bhāti tadā ekasmin sva rūpe yat anyat anyat rūpam tad virodha vaśāt asahabhavat kriyā ucyate
translated: And yet, the state of having different forms appears. In that one form, whatever other form is different, due to the power of contradiction, the actions that do not occur together are said to be.

original: tasyā yat vaicitryaṃ parimitāparimitātmakaṃ tadekānusandhānena phalasiddhyādinibandhanavaśāt yathāruci carcitena nirbhāsayan kālarūpaṃ kramamevāvabhāsayati
analyzed: tasyāḥ yat vaicitryam parimita aparimita ātmakam tad eka anusandhānena phala siddhi ādi nibandhana vaśāt yathāruci carcitena nirbhāsayan kāla rūpam kramam evā avabhāsayati
translated: The variety of that [consciousness], which is of the nature of limited and unlimited [objects], manifests as time, which is nothing but sequence, by manifesting according to one's liking through the connection with the result of the accomplishment of the effect, etc., by means of the single cognition [of consciousness].

original: na caitat vācyam ekasvarūpasya katham anyat anyadrūpamiti /
analyzed: na ca etat vācyam eka svarūpasya katham anyat anya rūpam iti
translated: And this should not be said: How can there be another form for something of a single nature?

original: yato na asau kaścit bhāvo ya evaṃ kalpyate /
analyzed: yatas na asau kaścid bhāvaḥ yaḥ evam kalpyate
translated: Because that entity which is imagined in this way does not exist at all.

analyzed: saṃvid eva hi tathā bhāti
translated: For consciousness itself shines in that way.

analyzed: tathā bhānam eva ca tasyāḥ aiśvaryam
translated: And that shining itself is its lordship.

original: na hi bhāsane virodhaḥ kaścit prabhavati /
analyzed: na hi bhāsane virodhaḥ kaścid prabhavati
translated: For there is no contradiction at all in shining.

analyzed: sa hi sukha duḥkha ādeḥ bhāsana kṛtaḥ eva
translated: For that [shining] is indeed produced by the shining of pleasure, pain, etc.

analyzed: tathā bhāsana abhāvaḥ eva hi virodha tattvam
translated: And the absence of shining in that way is indeed the truth of contradiction.

analyzed: etat apiśabdena īśvara śabdena ca darśitam
translated: This is also shown by the word 'api' (even) and by the word 'īśvara' (lord).

analyzed: nanu evam ābhāsa viṣayābhyām eva deśa kāla kramābhyām bhavitavyam
translated: Now, in this way, there must be space and time sequence only as the objects of manifestation.

analyzed: an ābhāsaḥ ca pramātā
translated: And the cognizer is not manifested.

analyzed: sa hi na kasyacid ābhāsate
translated: For he is not manifested to anyone.

analyzed: tasya sarvam ābhāti yatas
translated: For everything shines forth from him.

analyzed: tatas ca tau pramātari katham
translated: And how then are those two [space and time] in the cognizer?

original: dṛśyete ca abhavam ahaṃ bhavāmi bhavitāsmi iti /
analyzed: dṛśyete ca abhavam aham bhavāmi bhavitāsmi iti
translated: And it is seen that 'I was not', 'I am', 'I will be' (occur).

original: gṛhe tiṣṭhāmi araṇye devagṛhe iti ca /
analyzed: gṛhe tiṣṭhāmi araṇye devagṛhe iti ca
translated: And 'I stay at home', 'in the forest', 'in the temple'.

original: kiṃ ca svayaṃ deśakālakramaśūnyasya kiṃ dūraṃ kim antikaṃ kiṃ vartamānaṃ kim atītaṃ kiṃ bhāvi /
analyzed: kim ca svayam deśa kāla krama śūnyasya kim dūram kim antikam kim vartamānam kim atītam kim bhāvi
translated: Moreover, for one devoid of space and time sequence, what is far, what is near, what is present, what is past, what is future?

original: iti pramātrāśrayo bhāveṣvapi kramo na yuktaḥ /
analyzed: iti pramātṛ āśrayaḥ bhāveṣu api kramaḥ na yuktaḥ
translated: Thus, sequence is not proper even in entities that depend on the cognizer.

original: na ca pramātṛnirapekṣeṣvapi teṣu svātmani dūratvādi bhūtatvādi vā /
analyzed: na ca pramātṛ nirapekṣeṣu api teṣu sva ātmani dūra tva ādi bhūta tva ādi vā
translated: And even in those independent of the cognizer, distance etc. or pastness etc. are not (possible).

analyzed: tat etat samarthayitum āha
translated: To establish this, he says

analyzed: sarvatra ābhāsa bhedaḥ api bhavet kāla krama ākaraḥ
translated: The difference in appearances everywhere may be the source of temporal sequence.

analyzed: vicchinna bhāsaḥ śūnya ādeḥ mātuḥ bhātasya no sakṛt
translated: The disconnected appearance of the void etc. is not simultaneous for the cognizer.

analyzed: deśa kramaḥ api bhāveṣu bhāti mātuḥ mita ātmanaḥ
translated: Spatial sequence also appears in entities for the limited cognizer.

original: svātmeva svātmanā pūrṇā bhāvā bhāntyamitasya tu // / / //
analyzed: sva ātmā iva sva ātmanā pūrṇāḥ bhāvāḥ bhānti amitasya tu
translated: But for the infinite one, entities shine as full in their own nature, as in one's own self.

original: sarveṣu vastuṣu ekānekarūpeṣu yaḥ kālātmā kramaḥ tasya ya ākaraḥ utpattinibandhanam iti vyākhyātaḥ /
analyzed: sarveṣu vastubhiḥ eka aneka rūpeṣu yaḥ kāla ātmā kramaḥ tasya yaḥ ākaraḥ utpatti nibandhanam iti vyākhyātaḥ
translated: The soul of time, which is the sequence, in all things, whether one or many, is explained as the source, the cause of its origin.

original: ābhāsasya bhāvābhāvakṛto bhedaḥ sa śūnyaprāṇabuddhidehādeḥ bhavati /
analyzed: ābhāsasya bhāva abhāva kṛtaḥ bhedaḥ sa śūnya prāṇa buddhi deha ādeḥ bhavati
translated: The difference in appearance, caused by existence and non-existence, belongs to the void, life, intellect, body etc.

analyzed: iti saṃbhāvyati
translated: Thus it is imagined.

analyzed: yatas sa śūnya ādiḥ vicchinna bhās
translated: Because that emptiness etc. is interrupted in appearance.

original: na hi tasya bhāsanaṃ svarūpaṃ nīlādivat jaḍatvāt /
analyzed: na hi tasya bhāsanam svarūpam nīla ādi vat jaḍa tvāt
translated: For its appearance is not its own nature, like blue etc., because it is inert.

analyzed: api tu saṃvid sphuraṇam asya bhāsanam
translated: But rather the manifestation of consciousness is its appearance.

analyzed: tat yadā asya na asti
translated: When that does not exist for it,

original: yathā supto dehasya saṃsārayātrāpatitatve śūnyasya prāṇādeḥ /
analyzed: yathā suptaḥ dehasya saṃsāra yātrā patita tve śūnyasya prāṇa ādeḥ
translated: as in sleep, when the body has fallen into the course of worldly existence, or when the emptiness of vital breath etc.

analyzed: tadā asya bhāsanam vicchidyate
translated: Then its appearance is interrupted.

analyzed: iti ābhāsa sadbhāva asadbhāva kṛtaḥ kāla kramaḥ sti
translated: Thus there is a sequence of time created by the existence or non-existence of appearance.

analyzed: atītaḥ ham bāla deha ābhāsa rūpaḥ
translated: I was in the past in the form of the appearance of a child's body.

analyzed: bhavāmi yuva deha ābhāsa rūpaḥ iti
translated: I become in the form of the appearance of a young man's body.

original: sa ca yataḥ pramātā ahaṃbhāvasamāveśanāt aparipūrṇāt ata eva udriktakālakramavattvāt bhāveṣvapi kālakramam ābhāsayati /
analyzed: sa ca yatas pramātā ahaṃbhāva samāveśanāt a paripūrṇāt atas eva udrikta kāla kramavat tvāt bhāveṣu api kāla kramam ābhāsayati
translated: And that [sequence of time] is projected by him onto things as well, because he is the knower who, due to the incomplete immersion in the sense of 'I', has an increased sequence of time.

original: yo 'haṃ bālo 'bhavaṃ tatsahabhāvī vaṭābhāso 'pi abhavat iti /
analyzed: yaḥ ham bālaḥ bhavam tad sahabhāvī abhavat iti
translated: The appearance of the banyan tree that co-existed with me when I was a child also existed.

original: na tu yaḥ sakṛd vibhātaḥ iti anayā vācoyuktyā avicchinnabhāsanaḥ pramātā saṃvidrūpaḥ /
analyzed: na tu yaḥ sakṛt vibhātaḥ iti anayā vācoyuktyā avicchinna bhāsanaḥ pramātā saṃvid rūpaḥ
translated: But the knower, who is of the nature of consciousness and whose appearance is uninterrupted, is not [projected as having a sequence of time] by this statement he who has appeared once.

analyzed: tasya sva ātmani kāla kramaḥ
translated: For him there is no sequence of time in his own self.

analyzed: nā api tad apekṣayā vedye bhāva jāte
translated: Nor is there [a sequence of time] in the class of objects of knowledge in relation to that [knower].

analyzed: tat hi tatra abhedena bhāti iti
translated: For that appears there without distinction.

original: evaṃ deśakramo'pi mitātmanaḥ paricchinnasvarūpasya śūnyādeḥ dehāntasya svātmani bhāti iha tiṣṭhāmi iti /
analyzed: evam deśa kramaḥ api mita ātmanaḥ paricchinna svarūpasya śūnya ādeḥ dehāntasya sva ātmani bhāti iha tiṣṭhāmi iti
translated: Thus, the sequence of space also appears in the limited self, the limited form of Śūnya and others up to the body, in one's own self, as I exist here.

original: svāpekṣayā ca bhāveṣvapi yat mama saṃyogapārimityena vartate tadantikam itarat dūram iti /
analyzed: sva apekṣayā ca bhāveṣu api yat mama saṃyoga pārimityena vartate tat antikam itarat dūram iti
translated: And in relation to oneself, that which exists in beings as limited by my conjunction is near, the other is far.

original: amitasya svarūpeyattāśūnyasya tu saṃvittattvasya bhāvāḥ svātmanā ahaṃbhāvena yato bhānti tataḥ pūrṇāḥ aparicchinnasvarūpeyattākāḥ /
analyzed: amitasya sva rūpa iyattā śūnyasya tu saṃvid tattvasya bhāvāḥ sva ātmanā ahaṃbhāvena yatas bhānti tatas pūrṇāḥ aparicchinna sva rūpa iyattākāḥ
translated: But for the unlimited consciousness principle, which is devoid of the measure of its own form, the beings shine from it as the I in their own nature, therefore they are complete, having the measure of their own form as unlimited.

original: yataḥ svātmā tasya tathābhūta eva iti samuccayopamā / taduktam
analyzed: yatas sva ātmā tasya tathābhūtaḥ eva iti samuccaya upamā tat uktam
translated: Because the self of that is just such. This is a cumulative simile. It is said:

original: apūrvāparaṃ hi idaṃ mūrtitaḥ kriyātaśca sarvaṃ sarvataḥ pūrṇam
analyzed: apūrva aparam hi idam mūrtitaḥ kriyātaḥ ca sarvam sarvatas pūrṇam
translated: This entire universe is, from form and action, complete in every way, without beginning or end.

original: iti / kriyāprasaṅgāt iha kālakramaḥ prākarṇiko dṛṣṭāntatvena tatprasaṅgāt deśakramo nirūpitaḥ /
analyzed: iti kriyā prasaṅgāt iha kāla kramaḥ prākarṇikaḥ dṛṣṭānta tvena tad prasaṅgāt deśa kramaḥ nirūpitaḥ
translated: Due to the connection with action, the sequence of time, which was mentioned earlier, is described here as an example. Due to the connection with that, the sequence of space is determined.

original: dṛṣṭāntaśca pūrvaṃ vācya iti vaicitryanirūpaṇāvasare deśakramasya ādau abhidhānaṃ nyāyyam /
analyzed: dṛṣṭāntaḥ ca pūrvam vācyaḥ iti vaicitrya nirūpaṇa avasare deśa kramasya ādau abhidhānam nyāyyam
translated: And the example should be stated first. Therefore, it is proper to mention the sequence of space first at the time of determining the variety.

original: upasaṃhāre tu prākaraṇikasya kālakramasyaiva ādau nirdeśaḥ /
analyzed: upasaṃhāre tu prākaraṇikasya kāla kramasya eva ādau nirdeśaḥ
translated: But in the conclusion, the sequence of time, which is relevant, is mentioned first.

analyzed: paścāt tu prāsaṅgikasya deśa kramasya iti
translated: Afterwards, the sequence of space, which is incidental, is mentioned.🔽Now, if this is so, it follows that there is no action in the non-erroneous cognizer, the Lord, because there is no sequence of time, and because it (action) exists based on sequence.

original: nanu evaṃ satyapramātari bhagavati nāstyeva kriyā iti āyātaṃ kālakramābhāvāt kramāśrayeṇa ca tasyā avasthānāt ityāśaṅkyāha
analyzed: nanu evam sati apramātari bhagavati na asti eva kriyā iti āyātam kāla krama abhāvāt krama āśrayeṇa ca tasyāḥ avasthānāt iti āśaṅkya āha
translated: Thinking this, he says:

original: kintu nirmāṇaśaktiḥ sāpy evaṃ viduṣa īśituḥ /
analyzed: kintu nirmāṇa śaktiḥ sā api evam viduṣaḥ īśituḥ
translated: But that power of manifestation is also like this for the knowing Lord.

analyzed: tathā a vijñātṛ vijñeya bhedaḥ yat avabhāsyate
translated: The difference between the knower and the knowable, which is manifested in that way,

analyzed: iha tattvataḥ parameśvarasya apratihata svātantrya rūpa avicchinna sva ātma parāmarśa mayī
translated: Here, in reality, for the Supreme Lord, action is nothing but will, which is of the nature of unrestricted freedom and is full of the reflection of one's own nature,

original: ananyonmukhatārūpā icchaiva kriyā iti upasaṃhariṣyate adhikārāntare evam icchaiva
analyzed: an anya unmukha tā rūpā icchā eva kriyā iti upasaṃhariṣyate adhikāra antare evam icchā eva
translated: and which is not directed towards anything else. This will be concluded in another section that action is nothing but will,

analyzed: hetu tā kartṛ tā kriyā iti
translated: which is the cause, the agent, and the action.

original: caitramaitrāderapi pacāmi iti yaiva antaricchā saiva kriyā /
analyzed: caitra maitra ādeḥ api pacāmi iti yā eva antar icchā sā eva kriyā
translated: Even for Caitra, Maitra, and others, the action is nothing but the inner will to cook, expressed as I am cooking.

original: tathā ca adhiśrayaṇādibahutaraspandanasaṃbandhe 'pi pacāmi iti nāsya vicchidyate /
analyzed: tathā ca adhiśrayaṇa ādi bahutara spandana saṃbandhe pi pacāmi iti na asya vicchidyate
translated: And even when connected with many movements such as placing on the fire, etc., the thought I am cooking is not interrupted for him.

original: yattu pacāmi iti icchārūpaṃ tadeva tathāspandanātmatayā bhāti /
analyzed: yat tu pacāmi iti icchā rūpam tat eva tathā spandana ātma tayā bhāti
translated: But the form of desire, such as 'I am cooking', appears as that very [desire] in the form of vibration.

original: tatra tu na ko'pi kramaḥ tattvataḥ /
analyzed: tatra tu na kaḥ api kramaḥ tattvataḥ
translated: However, there is no sequence at all in reality there [in the form of desire].

original: evam īśvarasyāpi īśe bhāse sphurāmi dhūrṇe pratyavamṛśāmi ityevaṃrūpaṃ yadicchātmakaṃ vimarśanam aham ityetāvanmātratattvaṃ na tatra kaścit 🔽kramaḥ /
analyzed: evam īśvarasya api īśe bhāse sphurāmi dhūrṇe pratyavamṛśāmi iti evaṃrūpam yat icchā ātmakam vimarśanam aham iti etāvat mātra tattvam na tatra kaścid  / kramaḥ
translated: Similarly, if the reflective awareness in the form of 'I', which is the mere truth of 'I', is the desire of the Lord in the form of 'I am the Lord, I shine, I roll, I reflect', then there is no sequence at all there [in the form of desire].

original: etadeva ca ucyate pramātṛprameyavaicitryakrama ullasatu ityamunā vākyena /
analyzed: etat eva ca ucyate pramātṛ prameya vaicitrya kramaḥ ullasatu iti amunā vākyena
translated: And this very [desire] is said by the sentence 'may the sequence of the variety of knowers and objects of knowledge unfold' [in the Mālinīvijayottara].

analyzed: tat atra api na kaścid kramaḥ
translated: And here also there is no sequence at all.

original: yathā tu icchārūpaṃ pacāmi iti spandanātmatāṃ kāyāparyantāṃ gataṃ kramārūpitam ābhāti
analyzed: yathā tu icchā rūpam pacāmi iti spandana ātma tām kāya aparyantām gatam krama ārūpitam ābhāti
translated: But just as the form of desire, such as 'I am cooking', appears as if it has become the vibration-nature up to the body, arranged in the form of sequence,

original: tadā bhagavadicchā pramātṛprameyabhedaparyavasitā tatkramopaśliṣṭā bhāti darpaṇatalamiva
analyzed: tadā bhagavat icchā pramātṛ prameya bheda paryavasitā tad krama upaśliṣṭā bhāti darpaṇa talam iva
translated: then the desire of the Lord, which ends with the distinction of knowers and objects of knowledge, appears as if it is connected with that sequence, like the surface of a mirror,

analyzed: vitata prabahat nadī prabāha krama samāśliṣṭam
translated: connected with the sequence of the flowing of a wide river.

original: atra ca kevalaṃ darpaṇasya tathā icchā nāsti /
analyzed: atra ca kevalam darpaṇasya tathā icchā na asti
translated: And here, the mirror has no such desire at all.

original: parameśvarasya tu sā asti iti ubhayathā asya kriyāśaktiḥ kramarūpakriyānirmāṇasāmarthya kramarūpakriyoparāgayogaśca iti /
analyzed: parameśvarasya tu sā asti iti ubhayathā asya kriyāśaktiḥ krama rūpa kriyā nirmāṇa sāmarthya krama rūpa kriyā uparāga yogaḥ ca iti
translated: But that is not so in the case of the Supreme Lord. Thus, in both ways, His power of action is the ability to create action in the form of sequence, and the association with the manifestation of action in the form of sequence.

analyzed: evam deśa krame pi vācyam
translated: Similarly, it should be stated in the case of spatial sequence as well.

original: tatra tu asya cicchaktiḥ ucyate anyaiḥ /
analyzed: tatra tu asya cicchaktiḥ ucyate anyaiḥ
translated: But there, others speak of His power of consciousness.

original: iha tu kriyāśaktireva sā svīkṛtā iti piṇḍārthaḥ /
analyzed: iha tu kriyāśaktiḥ eva sā svīkṛtā iti piṇḍa arthaḥ
translated: But here, that same power is accepted as His power of action. This is the summary meaning.

original: akṣarārthastu tathā iti svarūpabhedena deśakramakāriṇā kriyābhedena ca kālakramasaṃpādakena upalakṣito yo vijñātuḥ śūnyādeḥ pramātuḥ bhedo'nyonyaṃ
analyzed: akṣara arthaḥ tu tathā iti svarūpa bhedena deśa krama kāriṇā kriyā bhedena ca kāla krama saṃpādakena upalakṣitaḥ yaḥ vijñātuḥ śūnya ādeḥ pramātuḥ bhedaḥ anyonyam
translated: As for the meaning of the words, the difference between the knower, beginning with Śiva, and the object of knowledge, which is characterized by the sequence in space due to the difference in form and the sequence in time brought about by the difference in action,

analyzed: jñeyāt ca
translated: and also between each other,

original: evaṃ ghaṭādeḥ parasparaṃ jñātuśca sa bhagavatā avabhāsyate /
analyzed: evam ghaṭa ādeḥ parasparam jñātuḥ ca sa bhagavatā avabhāsyate
translated: in that way, the Lord manifests that difference between the pot and so on, and between each other, and between the knower.

original: yat tadavabhāsanaṃ sā īśiturapi nirmāṇaśaktiḥ kriyāśaktiḥ na tu kevalaṃ śūnyādereva kriyā /
analyzed: yat tad avabhāsanam sā īśituḥ api nirmāṇa śaktiḥ kriyā śaktiḥ na tu kevalam śūnya ādeḥ eva kriyā
translated: That manifestation is the power of creation and the power of action of the Lord, and not merely the action of Śiva and others alone.

original: yataśca tannirmitaṃ jñātṛjñeyakriyāvaicitryabhedam asau vidvān vetti aviratam tatraiva hi tat sphurati tato'pi tasya sā kriyāśaktiḥ /
analyzed: yatas ca tat nirmitam jñātṛ jñeya kriyā vaicitrya bhedam asau vidvān vetti aviratam tatra eva hi tat sphurati tatas upi tasya sā kriyāśaktiḥ
translated: And because He, the knower, constantly knows that variety of differences in the action of the knower and the known created by Him, since that shines forth there itself, therefore, that is His power of action.

original: ato bhāsanavicchedanābhāvāt kramābhāve sthūladṛṣṭyā yadyapi asya bhavet kriyānupapattiśaṅkā /
analyzed: atas bhāsana vicchedana abhāvāt krama abhāve sthūla dṛṣṭyā yadi api asya bhavet kriyā anupapatti śaṅkā
translated: Therefore, due to the absence of interruption in manifestation, even though there may be a doubt about the impossibility of action from a gross perspective in the absence of sequence,

original: kiṃ tu evamasya kriyāśaktirūpapannā iti saṃgatiḥ /
analyzed: kim tu evam asya kriyāśaktiḥ ūpapannā iti saṃgatiḥ
translated: nevertheless, in this way, his power of action is established - this is the connection.

analyzed: iti śivam āditas
translated: Thus, auspiciousness... from the beginning.

analyzed: iti śrīmat ācārya utpaladeva pāda viracitāyām īśvarapratyabhijñāyām śrīmat ācārya abhinavagupta pāda kṛta vimarśinī ākhya ṭīkā upetāyām
translated: Thus, in the Isvarapratyabhijna composed by the illustrious teacher Utpaladeva, along with the commentary called Vimar-shini written by the illustrious teacher Abhinavagupta,

analyzed: kriyā adhikāre kriyāśaktinirūpaṇam nāma prathamam āhnikam
translated: in the chapter on action, the first chapter is named the determination of the power of action.

analyzed: kriyā adhikāre dvitīyam āhnikam
translated: The second chapter in the section on action.

analyzed: virodham avirodham ca sva icchayā eva upapādayan
translated: Establishing both contradiction and non-contradiction by his own will,

original: bhedābhedau ca yo mantratattvavittaṃ stumaḥ śivam ////
analyzed: bheda abhedau ca yaḥ mantra tattva vittam stumaḥ śivam
translated: and also difference and non-difference, we praise Shiva, the knower of the truth of mantras.

analyzed: yat uktam apratihata sāmarthyāt bahgavataḥ nirmāṇa śaktiḥ iti
translated: It has been said that the Lord's power of creation is due to his unobstructed ability.

analyzed: tat eva bāhya vāda darśana anupapadyamāna kriyā saṃbandha sāmānya ādi padārtha rāśi samarthana mukhena nirvāhayitum
translated: In order to carry that forward by means of supporting the mass of external philosophical views, which are not possible to connect with action, generality, etc.,

analyzed: kriyā saṃbandha sāmānya
translated: The general connection with action.

analyzed: ityādi
translated: And so on.

analyzed: tena na bhrāntiḥ īdṛśī
translated: Therefore, this kind of error does not occur.

analyzed: ityantam śloka saptakena āhnikam prastūyate
translated: Thus, the chapter is begun with these seven verses.

original: tatra prathamaślokena sūtrakalpena ekānekarūpasya kriyādeḥ bāhyavāde viruddhadharmādhyāsadūṣaṇena anupapadyamānasyāpyavaśyasamarthanīyaṃ vapuḥ
analyzed: tatra prathama ślokena sūtra kalpena eka aneka rūpasya kriyā ādeḥ bāhya vāde viruddha dharma adhyāsa dūṣaṇena anupapadyamānasya api avaśya samarthanīyam vapuḥ  /
translated: There, by the first verse, which is like a sutra, the form of action etc., which is one and many, is shown to be necessarily to be established, even though it is not logically possible, by refuting the superimposition of contradictory properties in the doctrine of external objects.

analyzed: iti darśayate
translated: This is shown.

analyzed: dvitīyena tatra upapattiḥ sūcyate
translated: By the second, the logical possibility there is indicated.

original: tṛtīyena nirvikalpakasaṃvedanasaṃvedyatve 'pi vikalpakāle eva sphuṭameṣāṃ rūpam ityucyate /
analyzed: tṛtīyena nirvikalpaka saṃvedana saṃvedya tve pi vikalpa kāle eva sphuṭam eṣām rūpam iti ucyate
translated: By the third, it is said that even though they are to be experienced by non-conceptual consciousness, their form is clearly manifest only at the time of conceptualization.

analyzed: caturtha pañcamābhyām eka aneka svarūpa tāyāḥ viaya vibhāgaḥ cintyate
translated: By the fourth and fifth, the division of the one and many forms is considered.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭhena prahaṇaka sūtra sūcita saṃbandha svīkṛtānām kriyā kāraka bhāva ādīnām svarūpam ucyate
translated: By the sixth, the nature of action, agent, etc., which are accepted as having the connection indicated by the Prahṇaka Sutra, is stated.

analyzed: saptamena artha kriyā upayogaḥ iti saṃkṣepaḥ
translated: By the seventh, the usefulness for purposeful activity. This is the summary.

original: nanvevaṃ tathā nirmāṇaśaktyā avabhāsanārūpayā yat nirmīyate tasyāvabhāsanaiva nirmāṇam /
analyzed: nanu evam tathā nirmāṇa śaktyā avabhāsanā rūpayā yat nirmīyate tasya avabhāsanā eva nirmāṇam
translated: Now, in this way, by the power of creation in the form of manifestation, what is created is only manifested.

analyzed: na anyat
translated: Nothing else.

analyzed: sā ca dvi candra ādeḥ api asti
translated: And that exists for the double moon etc. also.

analyzed: nīla ādeḥ api
translated: And for blue etc. also.

analyzed: nīla ādi niṣṭhasya karma sāmānya saṃbandha ādeḥ api
translated: And for the relation of action and universal etc. which reside in blue etc. also.

original: tataśca asatyaṃ satyaṃ saṃvṛtisatyamiti ya evaṃprāyeṣu vyavahāraḥ sa kathaṃ saṃgaccheta
analyzed: tatas ca asatyam satyam saṃvṛti satyam iti yaḥ evaṃprāyeṣu vyavahāraḥ sa katham saṃgaccheta
translated: And then, how would such a usage as false, true, conventional truth be coherent?🔽Fearing that [it would not be coherent] because of the non-distinction of what is to be created, [the author] says that the non-existence of action etc. is indeed established.

original: nirmeyatvāviśeṣāt ityāśaṃkya kriyādīnāmasatvatvaṃ tāvat nipapannam iti vadan dvicandrādīnāṃ
analyzed: nirmeya tva aviśeṣāt iti āśaṃkya kriyā ādīnām asatva tvam tāvat nipapannam iti vadan dvi candra ādīnām
translated: But for the double moon etc.,

original: tu itthamapi asatyatvam iti sūcayan āha
analyzed: tu ittham api asatya tvam iti sūcayan āha
translated: indicating that [they are false] in this way also, [the author] says:

analyzed: kriyā saṃbandha sāmānya dravya diś kāla buddhayaḥ
translated: The cognitions of action, relation, universal, substance, direction, and time,

analyzed: satyāḥ sthairya upayogābhyām eka aneka āśrayāḥ matāḥ
translated: Are considered true, based on one or many, due to stability and utility.

original: cittattvāt anyatra yā kriyābuddhiḥ kartṛkarmakaraṇādiṣu caitro bhrajati taṇḍulā viklidyante edhā jvalanti iti /
analyzed: citta ttvāt anyatra yā kriyā buddhiḥ kartṛ karma karaṇa ādiṣu caitraḥ bhrajati taṇḍulāḥ viklidyante edhāḥ jvalanti iti
translated: The cognition of action, which is different from the mind, in the agents, objects, instruments etc., such as Caitra cooks, rice is being crushed, fuel is burning,

analyzed: tasyāḥ eka aneka rūpaḥ caitra ādi arthaḥ āśrayaḥ ālambanam
translated: has Caitra etc. as its basis, as its object, which have the form of one or many.

original: tathāhi tattaddeśakālākārabhinnaḥ tatra caitradeho'nekasvabhāvo'pi sa evāyam iti ekarūpatām aparityajanneva nirbhāsate /
analyzed: tathā hi tad tad deśa kāla ākāra bhinnaḥ tatra caitra dehaḥ uneka svabhāvaḥ api saḥ eva ayam iti eka rūpa tām a parityajan eva nirbhāsate
translated: For thus, the body of Caitra, though having many natures in different places, times and forms, appears as if not abandoning its unitary nature, thinking this is the same one.

original: sa eva ca ekānekarūpā kriyā tathaiva pratibhāsanācca pāramārthikī /
analyzed: saḥ eva ca eka aneka rūpā kriyā tathā eva pratibhāsanāt ca pāramārthikī
translated: And that very action, having both a single and multiple form, is also real because it appears in that way.

original: dvicandrādi tu tathābhāsamānamapi uttarakālaṃ pramāvyāpārānuvṛttirūpasya sthairyasya unmūlanena dvicandro nāsti ityevaṃ rūpeṇa asatyam /
analyzed: dvi candra ādi tu tathā ābhāsamānam api uttara kālam pramā vyāpāra anuvṛtti rūpasya sthairyasya unmūlanena dvi candraḥ na asti iti evam rūpeṇa asatyam
translated: But the two moons and so on, though appearing thus, are unreal in the form the two moons do not exist by uprooting the stability in the form of the continuation of the activity of valid cognition at a later time.

original: iha punaḥ calati caitraḥ ityevaṃbhūto vimarśaḥ anuvartamāno na kenacit unmūlyamānaḥ saṃvedyate /
analyzed: iha punar calati caitraḥ iti evaṃbhūtaḥ vimarśaḥ anuvartamānaḥ na kenacid unmūlyamānaḥ saṃvedyate
translated: But here, the reflective awareness Caitra moves is experienced as continuing without being uprooted by anyone.

analyzed: dvi candra ādi ca yadi api hlāda udvegayoḥ upayujyate
translated: And although the two moons and so on are useful for pleasure and anxiety,

original: tathāpi dvicandrābhimānī na tāvatīṃ tatra arthakriyām abhimanyate /
analyzed: tathā api dvi candra abhimānī na tāvatīm tatra arthakriyām abhimanyate
translated: nevertheless, one who believes in the two moons does not imagine that much activity towards that goal.

original: api tu yādṛśī ekena śaśinā kartavyā timirāpasāraṇādirūpā /
analyzed: api tu yādṛśī ekena śaśinā kartavyā timira apasāraṇa ādi rūpā
translated: But rather, just as much as should be done by one moon, in the form of removing darkness and so on,

original: tādṛśyeva apareṇa /🔽iti na taddviguṇām arthakriyāṃ tatra adhyavasyati /
analyzed: tādṛśī eva apareṇa  iti na tad dviguṇām arthakriyām tatra adhyavasyati
translated: just as much by the other.🔽Thus, he does not determine that much double activity towards that goal.

analyzed: tasyām ca asau na upayujyate
translated: And that is not useful for that.

original: brajyāyāṃ tu yāmeva grāmaprāptim adhyavasyati tasyām avikalāyām upayogo 'syā iti sthairyāt upayogācca ekānekarūpakriyātattvālambanabuddhiḥ
analyzed: brajyāyām tu yām eva grāma prāptim adhyavasyati tasyām avikalāyām iti sthairyāt upayogāt ca eka aneka rūpa kriyā tattva ālambana buddhiḥ
translated: But in the case of the village, when one resolves to reach a particular village, as long as that is not incomplete, this [resolution] is useful for it. Because of stability and usefulness, there is a cognition that takes as its object the reality of a single or multiple form of action.

original: evaṃ saṃbandhādiṣu kālaparyanteṣu vācyam uttarakārikāsu sphuṭīkariṣyati ////
analyzed: evam saṃbandha ādiṣu kāla paryanteṣu vācyam uttara kārikāsu sphuṭīkariṣyati
translated: Similarly, in the case of relation and so on up to time, it will be clarified in the subsequent verses.

analyzed: nanu ekatvam anekatvam ca parasparam viruddhe
translated: Now, oneness and multiplicity are mutually contradictory.

analyzed: katham ekatra vastuni syātām
translated: How can they exist in one thing?

analyzed: tatas ca ayam bādhaka pramāṇa kṛtaḥ sthairya unmūlana prakāraḥ iti āśaṅkya āha
translated: And therefore, this is the way in which the stability is uprooted by the valid cognition that contradicts [the idea of stability], thinking this, he says:

analyzed: tatra ekam āntaram tattvam tat eva indriya vedya tām
translated: There, that one internal reality, having attained the state of being known by the senses,

original: saṃprāpyānekatāṃ yāti deśakālasvabhāvataḥ // / / //🔽iha tāvat caitre calati dṛṣṭe na jātucit na calati ayam iti buddhiḥ jāyate na rajatam itivat /
analyzed: saṃprāpya anekatām yāti deśa kāla svabhāvataḥ  iha tāvat caitre calati dṛṣṭe na jātucit na calati ayam iti buddhiḥ jāyate na rajatam itivat
translated: becomes many due to space, time, and nature.🔽Here, first, when Caitra is seen to move, the cognition never arises that he does not move, like the cognition this is not silver.

original: dvicandro 'pi nāyaṃ dvicandraḥ timiravaśāt aham upaplutanayanaḥ param evaṃ vedmi iti bhavati unmūlanābuddhiḥ /
analyzed: na ayam dvi candraḥ timira vaśāt aham upapluta nayanaḥ param evam vedmi iti bhavati unmūlanā buddhiḥ
translated: Even the double moon is not a double moon; rather, I know it to be so because my eyes are affected by an optical disorder.

original: yattu uktam ekameva katham anekaṃ bhavati iti /
analyzed: yat tu uktam ekam eva katham anekam bhavati iti
translated: But what was said - how can one be many?

original: tatra ucyate iha kāraṇameva katham akāraṇaṃ bhavati atha ucyate viṣayabhedāt tathā iti /
analyzed: tatra ucyate iha kāraṇam eva katham akāraṇam bhavati atha ucyate viṣaya bhedāt tathā iti
translated: To that it is said: here how can the cause itself be non-cause? If it is said that it is so due to the difference in objects,

original: tadviṣayabhede etat na virudhyate iti kena ayaṃ vitīrṇo'vasaraḥ /
analyzed: tad viṣaya bhede etat na virudhyate iti kena ayam vitīrṇa uvasaraḥ
translated: then this is not contradicted in the difference of those objects. By whom is this opportunity given?

original: saṃvedanena iti cet calati ityādau saṃvedanameva asmāmiḥ pramāṇīkṛtaṃ kimiti na sahyate /
analyzed: saṃvedanena iti ced calati ityādau saṃvedanam eva asmāmiḥ pramāṇīkṛtam kim iti na sahyate
translated: If it is said by the cognition, then why is the cognition itself accepted by us in the case of 'moving' etc. not accepted?

original: viṣayabhedo 'pi ca atra vaktuṃ na na śakyate /
analyzed: ca atra vaktum na na śakyate
translated: And the difference in objects here also cannot be said to be impossible.

analyzed: tathā hi ābhāsa antareṇa a saṃbhedane tat eka ābhāsa mātram
translated: Thus, when not differentiated by another appearance, it is merely that one appearance.

original: ata eva anyāpekṣāviyogāt antaraṅgatvāt āntaram anuvartamānaṃ tathābhūtābhāsamātragrahaṇocitāntaḥkaraṇavedyatayā
analyzed: atas eva anya apekṣā viyogāt antaraṅga tvāt āntaram anuvartamānam tathābhūta ābhāsa mātra grahaṇa ucita antaḥkaraṇa vedya tayā
translated: For this very reason, due to the absence of dependence on another, due to being internal, following internally, known by the internal organ fit to grasp only such an appearance,

original: ca āntaraṃ tathāsvarūpāparicyuteḥ tattvam ābhāsāntarayogena tananasahiṣṇutvācca tattvam
analyzed: ca āntaram tathā svarūpa a paricyuteḥ tattvam ābhāsa antara yogena tanana sahiṣṇu tvāt ca tattvam
translated: and internally, due to not deviating from that nature, and due to being the truth due to being able to expand by the union with another appearance,

original: ekam iti pratīyate /🔽tadeva deśābhāsena iha amutra iti /
analyzed: ekam iti pratīyate  tat eva deśa ābhāsena iha amutra iti
translated: it is cognized as one.🔽That itself by the appearance of space as 'here' and 'there'.

analyzed: kāla ābhāsena adhunā tadānīm iti
translated: By the appearance of time as 'now' and 'then'.

analyzed: svabhāva ābhāsena kṛśaḥ sthūlaḥ ityādinā
translated: By the appearance of its own nature, it is perceived as thin, thick, etc.

analyzed: miśritayā anekam iti bāhya indriya vedya tāyām pratīyate tathā
translated: By the mixed [appearance], it is perceived as many in the state of being known by external senses. Thus

analyzed: svāminaḥ ca ātma saṃsthasya
translated: and of the Lord, who resides in the Self...

original: iti uktanītyā viśvameva ānantaraṃ sat ekam / tadeva
analyzed: iti ukta nītyā viśvam eva ānantaram sat ekam tat eva
translated: In this way, the entire universe, which is immediately existent, is one. That very
[universe] has the nature of being known by both senses, which revolve internally.

analyzed: iti vakṣyamāṇa kārya kāraṇa bhāva tattva dṛṣṭyā intriya vedya tāyām anekam
translated: Thus, from the perspective of the truth of the relation of cause and effect that will be stated, it is many in the state of being known by the senses.

analyzed: deśa ādi ābhāsa miśraṇāt iti  eka tvam ābhāsa antara amiśra tāyām antaḥkaraṇa eka vedya tve cit mātra tāyām
translated: Because of the mixture of appearances of space, etc.🔽Unity is in the state of being known by the internal organ alone, in the mixing of one appearance with another, in the state of pure consciousness.

original: anekatvaṃ punar ābhāsāntaramiśratāyām uvhayakaraṇavedyatve cidatiriktatābhāsane ca /
analyzed: aneka tvam punar ābhāsa antara miśra tāyām cit atirikta tā bhāsane ca
translated: Plurality, on the other hand, is in the state of being known by both senses, in the appearance of consciousness as something other than pure consciousness, in the mixing of one appearance with another.

analyzed: iti sphuṭaḥ viṣaya bhedaḥ
translated: Thus, the difference of objects is clear.

original: tasyaiva ca tathātvam iti parāmarśabalādeva kāraṇākāraṇavat upādānasahakārivat /
analyzed: tasya eva ca tathātvam iti parāmarśa balāt eva kāraṇa akāraṇa vat upādāna sahakāri vat
translated: And that very [consciousness] has such a nature. By the power of reflective awareness alone, like a cause and non-cause, like a material cause and a cooperating cause,

original: atha vyapadeśamātram etat kāraṇam akāraṇaṃ ca ityādi /
analyzed: atha vyapadeśa mātram etat kāraṇam akāraṇam ca ityādi
translated: If, on the other hand, this is merely a designation, that it is a cause or not a cause, etc.,

analyzed: tat iha api ekam anekam iti vyavahāra mātram
translated: then here also, the usage of one and many is merely conventional.

original: nīlaṃ pītam avikalpakaṃ savikalpakam ityapi sarvaṃ māyāpade vyavahāramātram iti sarvaṃ samānam /
analyzed: nīlam pītam avikalpakam sa vikalpakam iti api sarvam māyā pade vyavahāra mātram iti sarvam samānam
translated: Blue, yellow, non-conceptual, conceptual - all this is mere usage in the realm of illusion. Thus everything is the same.

analyzed: tasmāt ekatva anekatva virodhaḥ na bādhakaḥ
translated: Therefore, the contradiction of oneness and plurality is not a refutation.

analyzed: tat etat eva kāreṇa uktam
translated: This is stated by the word eva (only).

original: tatra iti / teṣu kriyādiṣu yat āntaraṃ tattvaṃ tadekam /
analyzed: tatra iti teṣu kriyā ādiṣu yat āntaram tattvam tat ekam
translated: There means among those actions etc., that internal reality is one.

original: tadeva indriyavedyatāṃ prāpya deśādibhedāt anekatāṃ yāti iti saṃbandhaḥ /
analyzed: tat eva indriya vedya tām prāpya deśa ādi bhedāt anekatām yāti iti saṃbandhaḥ
translated: That very [reality] becomes many due to differences in place etc. by becoming perceptible to the senses. This is the connection.

analyzed: tatra iti satya tve sthite
translated: There means in the case of truth.

original: tayorvā ekatvānekatvayoḥ madhye ekatvamevam anekatvamevam iti vā yojanā ////
analyzed: tayoḥ vā ekatva anekatvayoḥ madhye ekatvam evam anekatvam evam iti vā yojanā
translated: Or the construction is: Among those two, oneness and manyness, oneness is thus, manyness is thus.

original: nanu evaṃ viṣayabhede abhyupagamyamāne yadā ekaṃ pratibhātaṃ bhavati tadā na anekam /
analyzed: nanu evam viṣaya bhede abhyupagamyamāne yadā ekam pratibhātam bhavati tadā na anekam
translated: But if the difference of objects is thus accepted, when one appears, then many do not.

analyzed: aneka pratibhāse ca na ekam pratibhātam
translated: And when many appear, one does not appear.

analyzed: iti katham eka aneka rūpam vastu syāt
translated: So how can an object have a form that is both one and many?

original: tathāhi bāhyena indriyeṇa caitro vicitradeśakaḥ param anubhūyate /
analyzed: tathā hi bāhyena indriyeṇa caitraḥ vicitra deśakaḥ param anubhūyate
translated: For thus, Caitra is perceived by the external sense as having various places.

original: na tu anekābhāsasaṃmiśrīkāre bāhyendriyajasya avikalpakasya vyāpāraḥ saṃnihitaviṣayabalotpatteḥ avicārakatvāt ityāhuḥ /
analyzed: na tu aneka ābhāsa saṃmiśrīkāre bāhya indriya jasya avikalpakasya vyāpāraḥ saṃnihita viṣaya bala utpatteḥ avicāraka tvāt iti āhuḥ
translated: But in the mixing of many appearances, the function of the external sense-born non-conceptual [cognition] does not operate, because it arises by the power of the present object and is non-reflective, so they say.

original: vikalpenāpi mānasena tathābhūtaṃ vastu naiva spṛśyate iti kayā dhiyā vastu ekānekarūpaṃ gṛhyeta /
analyzed: vikalpena api mānasena tathābhūtam vastu nā eva spṛśyate iti kayā dhiyā vastu eka aneka rūpam gṛhyeta
translated: Even with mental conceptualization, such a thing is not touched, so by what cognition would a thing be grasped as one or many?

analyzed: iti para vyāmoha nibarhaṇāya āha
translated: Thus, to dispel the delusion of others, he says:

analyzed: tad dvaya ālambanāḥ etāḥ manonuvyavasāyi sat
translated: These [cognitions] have that duality as their object, and being the mental cognition of the self,

analyzed: karoti mātṛ vyāpāra mayīḥ karma ādi kalpanāḥ
translated: They perform the functions of the mother, such as the conception of karma and so on.

original: iha jñānamālāyā antaḥsūtrakalpaḥ svasaṃvedanātmā pramātā jīvitabhūtaḥ iti upapāditaṃ prāk /
analyzed: iha jñānamālāyāḥ antar sūtra kalpaḥ sva saṃvedana ātmā pramātā jīvita bhūtaḥ iti upapāditam prāk
translated: Here, it has been previously established that the knower, whose nature is self-awareness, is the life-force of the garland of cognitions.

analyzed: sa ca svatantraḥ iti api nirṇītam
translated: And it has also been determined that he is independent.

analyzed: sa tu viśuddha svabhāvaḥ śiva ātmā
translated: But he, whose nature is pure, is of the nature of Śiva.

analyzed: māyā pade tu saṃkucita svabhāvaḥ paśuḥ
translated: But at the level of Māyā, his contracted nature is that of the individual soul.

analyzed: tat asya manaḥ samullāsa avasare vikalpa bhūmikāyām sphuṭaḥ ullāsaḥ
translated: At the time of the arousal of his mind, his clear arousal is on the stage of conceptualization.

analyzed: aindriyake nirvikalpake sadāśiva īśvara daśa abhyudayāt
translated: In the external non-conceptual [cognition], due to the manifestation of the state of Sadāśiva and Īśvara,
The function of reflective awareness is external to non-conceptual cognition.

original: paścādbhāvinaṃ vyavasāyaṃ niścayātmakaṃ vikalpakam anuvyavasāyaśabdavācyaṃ vidadhadantaḥkaraṇam etān kriyāsaṃbandhādivikalpān saṃpādayati /
analyzed: paścāt bhāvinam vyavasāyam niścaya ātmakam vikalpakam anuvyavasāya śabda vācyam vidadhat antaḥkaraṇam etān kriyā saṃbandha ādi vikalpān saṃpādayati
translated: The internal organ, producing the subsequent determination, which is of the nature of ascertainment, which is conceptual, and is denoted by the word 'anuvyavasāya' (subsequent cognition), accomplishes these conceptual distinctions such as the relation of action.

original: te ca vikalpāḥ taddvayam ekatvānekatvarūpam avalambante /
analyzed: te ca vikalpāḥ tad dvayam ekatva anekatva rūpam avalambante
translated: And these concepts depend on that duality, which is of the nature of unity and plurality.

original: nahi vikalpeṣu pratibhāsamānam avastusat iti hi uktam prakāśataiva vastutvam iti /
analyzed: nahi vikalpeṣu pratibhāsamānam avastu sat iti hi uktam prakāśa tā eva vastu tvam iti
translated: For it has been said that what appears in concepts is not real, that manifestation itself is reality.

original: na ca vikalpasya prakāśarūpatāṃ muktvā āropaṇādhyavasāyābhimānādināmadheyaṃ vyāpārāntaraṃ yuktam /
analyzed: na ca vikalpasya prakāśa rūpa tām muktvā āropaṇa adhyavasāya abhimāna ādi nāmadheyam vyāpāra antaram yuktam
translated: And apart from the form of manifestation of the concept, it is not proper to posit another operation such as superimposition, determination, identification, etc.

original: tato 'bāhye bāhyam āropayanti ityādi vaco vastuśūnyam /
analyzed: tatas bāhye bāhyam āropayanti ityādi vacaḥ vastu śūnyam
translated: Therefore, the statement that they superimpose the external on the non-external, etc., is devoid of substance.

analyzed: tat ca etat uktam
translated: And this has been stated

analyzed: bhrānti tve ca avasāyasya
translated: And in the case of the error of ascertainment, etc., etc.

original: ityatra / atha brūyāt paro yat indriyajñānena prakāśanīyaṃ svalakṣaṇaṃ tat kathaṃ vikalpaḥ spṛśediti /
analyzed: iti atra atha brūyāt paraḥ yat indriya jñānena prakāśanīyam sva lakṣaṇam tat katham vikalpaḥ spṛśet iti
translated: Now, if the opponent were to say that the specific property to be manifested by sense perception, how can that be touched by a concept?

original: bhavedevaṃ yadi vikalpo nāma svatantro bhavet /
analyzed: bhavet evam yadi vikalpaḥ nāma svatantraḥ bhavet
translated: This would be so if the concept were independent.

original: yāvatā pramāturasau vyāpāraḥ pramātā ca pūrvānubhavāntaḥsvasaṃvedanarūpaḥ tadasya🔽ca ayameva pūrvānubhavasaṃskāro yat vikalpanavyāpārakāle 'pi pūvānubhavātmatvam anujjhanneva āste /
analyzed: yāvatā pramātuḥ asau vyāpāraḥ pramātā ca pūrva anubhava antar sva saṃvedana rūpaḥ tat asya  ca ayam eva pūrva anubhava saṃskāraḥ yat vikalpana vyāpāra kāle pi pūva anubhava ātma tvam anujjhan eva āste
translated: As long as this activity of the cognizer is the cognizer in the form of self-awareness within the previous experience, then🔽this very impression of the previous experience, even at the time of the activity of conceptualization, remains as if not abandoning the nature of the previous experience.

original: tataḥ pūrvānubhavo yāvat svalakṣaṇakāśanātmā tāvat pūrvānubhavatādātmyāpannapramātṛtattvavyāpāro 'pi vikalpastadviṣaya eva /
analyzed: tatas pūrva anubhavaḥ yāvat sva lakṣaṇa kāśana ātmā tāvat pūrva anubhava tādātmya āpanna pramātṛ tattva vyāpāraḥ pi vikalpaḥ tad viṣayaḥ eva
translated: Therefore, as long as the previous experience is in the form of manifesting its own particular characteristic, the activity of the cognizer, which has attained identity with the previous experience, is also conceptualization, and it has that as its object.

analyzed: atas evam uktam ācāryeṇa
translated: For this very reason, the teacher has said

analyzed: pūrva anubhava saṃskāraḥ pramātuḥ ayam eva saḥ
translated: This is indeed the impression of the previous experience of the cognizer,

analyzed: yat apohana kāle api sa pūrva anubhavaḥ sthitaḥ
translated: that even at the time of negation, that previous experience remains.

original: iti / tasmāt pramātuḥ yo vyāpāra ekatvānekatvasaṃyojanātmā sa eva prakṛto tatra tādṛśīḥ kriyādikalpanā ekānekavastuviṣayā etā iti grahaṇakavākyasūcitā
analyzed: iti tasmāt pramātuḥ yaḥ vyāpāraḥ ekatva anekatva saṃyojana ātmā saḥ eva tatra tādṛśīḥ kriyā ādi kalpanāḥ eka aneka vastu viṣayāḥ etāḥ iti grahaṇaka vākya sūcitā  /
translated: Therefore, the activity of the cognizer, which is in the form of connecting with oneness and manyness, is itself the subject under discussion. The conceptualizations of action etc. in that case are indicated by the sūtra verse as having objects that are one or many.

original: mana eva karoti iti sthitam /🔽yadyapi avikalpe'pi sāmānyādyavabhāso ghaṭamātrāvabhāsādau /
analyzed: manaḥ eva karoti iti sthitam  yadi api avikalpe pi sāmānya ādi avabhāsaḥ ghaṭa mātra avabhāsa ādau
translated: It is established that the mind alone does this.🔽Even though the manifestation of universals etc. occurs in the mere manifestation of a pot etc., even without conceptualization,

analyzed: tathā api na tadā sāmānya ādi sphuṭam
translated: nevertheless, at that time, the universal etc. is not clear.
In the case of a common modifier, arising from both relata, abandoning the continuum of successive moments, accepting a collection of parts,

analyzed: avadhya vadhimat parigraha ādau sāmānya saṃbandha kriyā dravya diś ādi padārthasya paramārthataḥ sphuraṇāt
translated: accepting the limited and the limited-possessor, etc., the real manifestation of the categories such as universals, relations, actions, substances, directions, etc.

original: iti mānasavikalpagrāhyā ekānekarūpāḥ sāmānyādayaḥ iti sthitam /
analyzed: iti mānasa vikalpa grāhyāḥ eka aneka rūpāḥ sāmānya ādayaḥ iti sthitam
translated: Thus, it is established that universals, etc., which are grasped by mental conceptualization, are of one or many forms.

analyzed: evam ca saṃvṛttiḥ vikalpa buddhiḥ
translated: And thus, convention is conceptual cognition.

original: tadvaśāt ucyatāṃ saṃvṛtisatyatvaṃ satyatvasyaiva tu prakāraḥ tat /
analyzed: tad vaśāt ucyatām saṃvṛti satya tvam satya tvasya eva tu prakāraḥ tat
translated: Let the truth of conventional reality be spoken of by its power, but the mode of truth itself is that.

analyzed: iti dvi candra ādi vat na asatyatā
translated: Thus, like the two moons, etc., it is not untrue.

original: tatra ca ayaṃ saṃvidavataraṇakramo yat kriyāśaktereva ayaṃ sarvo visphāraḥ /
analyzed: tatra ca ayam saṃvid avataraṇa kramaḥ yat kriyāśakteḥ eva ayam sarvaḥ visphāraḥ
translated: And in that, this is the sequence of descent of consciousness: this entire expansion is of the power of action itself.

analyzed: tatra api sambandhaḥ eva mūla bhūtaḥ
translated: Even there, relation itself is fundamental.

original: tathāhi samānānāṃ yat ekaṃ bhāti tat sāmānyam /
analyzed: tathā hi samānānām yat ekam bhāti tat sāmānyam
translated: Thus, that which appears as one among the similar is the universal.

analyzed: devadattasya yat vaitatyam sā kriyā
translated: The expansion of Devadatta is action.

original: avayavānāṃ yadaikyaṃ vaitatyaṃ ca deśataḥ so'vayavī /
analyzed: avayavānām yat aikyam vaitatyam ca deśataḥ saḥ avayavī
translated: The unity and expansion in space of the parts is the whole.

original: imam avadhiṃ kṛtvā ayam ittham tato 'sya ayaṃ purastāt ityādirdik /
analyzed: imam avadhim kṛtvā ayam ittham tatas sya ayam purastāt ityādiḥ diś
translated: Having made this limit, this is so, from this, this is in front of it, etc., is direction.

original: asyāyaṃ kriyāpratānaḥ sahabhāvena āste vinābhāvena vā iti vartamānādiḥ kālaḥ /
analyzed: asya ayam kriyā pratānaḥ sahabhāvena āste vinābhāvena vā iti vartamāna ādiḥ kālaḥ
translated: This is the expansion of action, whether it exists simultaneously or not. This is the present and other times.

original: yāvat hi prātipadikārthasya pṛṣṭapāti vapuḥ bhāti tadatiriktaṃ sarvaṃ saṃbandha eva iti kārakāṇāmapi saṃbandharūpataiva /
analyzed: yāvat hi prātipadika arthasya pṛṣṭapāti vapuḥ bhāti tad atiriktam sarvam saṃbandhaḥ eva iti kārakāṇām api saṃbandha rūpa tā eva
translated: As long as the meaning of the basic noun shines with its own form, everything else is only the relation. Thus, even the instrumental cases are of the nature of relation.

original: kevalaṃ kvacit asau saṃbandho vyapadeśāntaragranthiṃ sahate /
analyzed: kevalam kvacid asau saṃbandhaḥ vyapadeśa antara granthim sahate
translated: In some cases, this relation can bear the knot of another designation.

original: yathā sāsrādimatāṃ saṃbandho gāvaḥ iti ekavyapadeśasahiṣṇuḥ tatra sāmānyādivyavahāraḥ /
analyzed: yathā sa asra ādimatām saṃbandhaḥ gāvaḥ iti eka vyapadeśa sahiṣṇuḥ tatra sāmānya ādi vyavahāraḥ
translated: For example, the relation of cows, etc. can bear the single designation cows. There, the usage of universals, etc. is based on that.

analyzed: vyapadeśa antara granthi bhaṅge tu saṃbandhāt coyuktiḥ eva
translated: But when the knot of another designation is broken, the relation itself is the only means of knowledge.

original: ata eva diṣṭiprasthapalādipramāṇaparimāṇonmānarūpaṃ tatra antargataṃ vā aṇumahadādi saṃkhyāpṛthaktvādi ca yat tat sarvaṃ saṃbandhasyaiva vijṛmbhitam
analyzed: atas eva diṣṭi prastha pala ādi pramāṇa parimāṇa unmāna rūpam tatra antargatam vā aṇu mahat ādi saṃkhyā pṛthaktva ādi ca yat tat sarvam saṃbandhasya eva vijṛmbhitam
translated: For this very reason, the form of measurement, such as the measure of a palmyra tree, the weight of an atom, the largeness, etc., and the number, separateness, etc. included in it, all that is the manifestation of the relation itself.

original: ye 'pi sāmānyādi vastvantaram amaṃsata te 'pi tatra samavāyam abhyupajagmuḥ jīvitatvena /
analyzed: ye pi sāmānya ādi vastu antaram amaṃsata te pi tatra samavāyam abhyupajagmuḥ jīvita tvena
translated: Even those who considered the universal, etc. to be a separate entity, they also accepted inherence as the vital principle there.

original: samavāyaśca saṃbandhātmā tadanugrāhyo vā keṣāṃcit / yata āhuḥ
analyzed: samavāyaḥ ca saṃbandha ātmā tad anugrāhyaḥ vā keṣāṃcid yatas āhuḥ
translated: And the aggregate is either the nature of the relation or is to be favored by some, since it is said:

analyzed: samavāya ākhyām tām śaktim anugṛhṇāti saṃbandhaḥ
translated: The relation favors that power called inherence.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

analyzed: yat api ca kārakam tat api kriyā mukha prekṣi
translated: And whatever is an instrument, that also looks to the face of action.

analyzed: sā api kālam prāṇeśvaram āśrayati
translated: That also depends on time, the lord of life.

original: so 'pi kriyādvāreṇa sarvabhāvātmā sambandham uddhurayati iti saṃbandhādhīnaiva iyaṃ citrā lokayātrā /
analyzed: saḥ pi kriyā dvāreṇa sarva bhāva ātmā sambandham uddhurayati iti saṃbandha adhīnā eva iyam citrā lokayātrā
translated: He also, through the door of action, makes the relation of the self of all things firm. Thus this variegated worldly life depends on relation alone.

analyzed: yat āha ācāryaḥ eva
translated: As the teacher himself says:
The world's progress, which accomplishes all objects through the relation of difference and non-difference,

analyzed: lokayātrā ākṛtiḥ yasya sva icchayā naumi tam śivam
translated: I praise that Śiva, who creates it by his own will.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: ataḥ saṃbandhameva prathamaṃ nirūpayitum āha 🔽svātmaniṣṭhā viviktābhā bhāvā ekapramātari /
analyzed: atas saṃbandham eva prathamam nirūpayitum āha
translated: Therefore, in order to first determine the relation, he says:

analyzed: anyonya anvaya rūpa aikya yujaḥ saṃbandha dhī padam
translated: The entities, abiding in their own nature, having distinct appearances, united with oneness in the form of mutual connection, are the basis for the cognition of relation, in the one cognizer.

original: rājā puruṣaśca bahistaṭasthau svātmaikaparisamāptau pramātṛbhūmau yadaikyaṃ gacchataḥ /
analyzed: rājā puruṣaḥ ca bahis taṭasthau sva ātma eka parisamāptau pramātṛ bhūmau yadā aikyam gacchataḥ
translated: The king and the man, remaining outside, on the ground of the cognizer who is complete only in his own self, become one.

analyzed: na ca aikya mātram tayoḥ bheda vigalana āpatteḥ
translated: And it is not mere oneness for them, because of the attainment of the dissolution of difference.

analyzed: api tu paraspara rūpa śleṣa ātmakam yugapad eva nimajjat unmajjat bheda abheda koṭi dvaya dolā ārohaṇa lakṣaṇam anvaya rūpam
translated: Rather, it is the form of inherence, which is characterized by the simultaneous ascent and descent of the two poles of identity and difference, which merge and emerge from each other.

original: tadā tāveva sambandhadhiya ālambanaṃ bhavato rājñaḥ puruṣaḥ iti /
analyzed: tadā tau eva sambandha dhiyaḥ ālambanam bhavataḥ rājñaḥ puruṣaḥ iti
translated: Then those two are the basis for the cognition of the relation, as in the man of the king.

original: tathāhi rājā yadā pūrvaṃ dhiyā gṛhīto 'pi na svātmaviśrāntyā tuṣyati tadā rūpāntareṇa puṃsā śleṣaṃ bhajan kṛtārthībhavati /
analyzed: tathā hi rājā yadā pūrvam dhiyā gṛhītaḥ u pi na sva ātma viśrāntyā tuṣyati tadā rūpa antareṇa puṃsā śleṣam bhajan kṛtārthībhavati
translated: For when the king, even though grasped by the mind before, is not satisfied by resting in his own self, then he becomes fulfilled by enjoying union with a man of another form.

analyzed: puruṣaḥ pi evam
translated: And the man is also like this.

original: sa ca eṣa rūpaśleṣa eka eva ubhayoḥ cidātmani tathā avasthānarūpaḥ pūrvapratilabdhasaṃvitpratiṣṭhaḥ
analyzed: sa ca eṣa rūpa śleṣaḥ ekaḥ eva ubhayoḥ cit ātmani tathā avasthāna rūpaḥ pūrva pratilabdha saṃvid pratiṣṭhaḥ
translated: And that form of union is one only for both, which is the form of resting in the self of consciousness, established in the previously attained awareness.

original: tata eva adhikasaṃviśrimajjanāt anābhāsamānapṛthagbhavanalakṣaṇaḥ svātantrye viśrāmyati /
analyzed: tatas eva adhika saṃviśri majjanāt an ābhāsamāna pṛthagbhavana lakṣaṇaḥ svātantrye viśrāmyati
translated: From that itself, due to the submergence of the greater repose, characterized by the non-manifestation of separate existence, it rests in independence.

analyzed: iti tatra eva nirbhāsate
translated: Thus, the external man, whose reality is surpassed, also appears there itself.

analyzed: evam bahis anekatā
translated: Thus, externally there is multiplicity.

analyzed: antar tu paraspara rūpa śleṣeṇa aikyam
translated: But internally, by the union of forms, there is oneness.

analyzed: iti saṃbandhasya rūpam
translated: Thus is the form of the relation.

analyzed: jāti dravya avabhāsānām bahis api eka rūpa tām
translated: The appearance of universals and substances, even externally, is of one form.

analyzed: vyakti eka deśa bhedam ca api ālambante vikalpanāḥ
translated: And also the differences of the individual parts are the objects of conceptual cognitions.

original: jātyavabhāsasya avabhāsamānarūpāyāḥ jāteḥ grāhikā yāḥ kalpanāḥ /
analyzed: jāti avabhāsasya avabhāsamāna rūpāyāḥ jāteḥ grāhikāḥ yāḥ kalpanāḥ
translated: The conceptual cognitions that apprehend the universal which appears as having the form of manifestation,

original: tā na kevalaṃ saṃbandhavat antar ekarūpatāṃ bahiśca anekarūpatām ālambante /
analyzed: tāḥ na kevalam saṃbandha vat antar eka rūpa tām bahis ca aneka rūpa tām ālambante
translated: not only have as their object the internal oneness along with the relation, and the external manifoldness,

original: yāvad bahirapi vyaktibhedalakṣaṇam anaikyaṃ bahireva ca tadanusyūtatārūpām ekatām ālambanatvaṃ nayanti /
analyzed: yāvat bahis api vyakti bheda lakṣaṇam anaikyam bahis eva ca tad anusyūta tā rūpām ekatām ālambana tvam nayanti
translated: but also bring about the external non-oneness characterized by the difference of individuals, and the oneness which is the continuous form external to that.

original: gāvaḥ iti hi pratibhāse pṛthakkṛtā bahir vyaktayo bhānti /
analyzed: gāvaḥ iti hi pratibhāse pṛthakkṛtāḥ bahis vyaktayaḥ bhānti
translated: For in the appearance as cows, the external individuals appear as separated.

analyzed: yena ca bahuvacanam
translated: And by which there is the plural number.

original: anuyāyi ca āsāṃ bhāti vapuḥ yata ekaprātipadikārthaparāmarśānugamaḥ /
analyzed: anuyāyi ca āsām bhāti vapuḥ yatas eka prātipadika artha parāmarśa anugamaḥ
translated: And the body of them appears as continuous, from which there is the comprehension of the meaning of the single nominal stem.

original: ubhayaṃ ca tad bahireva imāḥ iti aṅgulyā nirdeśāt /
analyzed: ubhayam ca tat bahis eva imāḥ iti aṅgulyā nirdeśāt
translated: And both of those are external only, because they are indicated by the finger as these.

analyzed: kevalam bāhya tvam api sthite paramārtha prakāśa antarbhāve
translated: And the externalness also is only when the ultimate manifestation is included within.

original: iti na tatra bhedābhedau dūṣaṇaṃ citrasaṃvedana iva /
analyzed: iti na tatra bheda abhedau dūṣaṇam citra saṃvedane iva
translated: Thus, there is no fault of difference or non-difference there, as in the case of the cognition of a variegated [object].

analyzed: anena dravye pi rakta a rakta ādi virodhaḥ kṛta pratividhānaḥ
translated: By this, the contradiction of the colored and uncolored etc. in substance is also refuted.

original: āntaraṃ tu aikyaṃ saṃbandhadvāreṇa tadvadeva sarvatra /
analyzed: āntaram tu aikyam saṃbandha dvāreṇa tadvat eva sarvatra
translated: But the internal unity is everywhere in the same way through the medium of relation.

original: evam avabhāsamānasya ghaṭa iti avayavidravyasya prāhikā yāḥ kalpanāḥ tā na kevalaṃ
analyzed: evam avabhāsamānasya ghaṭaḥ iti avayavi dravyasya prāhikāḥ yāḥ kalpanāḥ tāḥ na kevalam
translated: Thus, the imaginations that are the basis of the appearance of the composite substance called pot, not only

original: saṃbandhavat antarbahīrūpatayā ekānekaviṣayā yāvat bahirapyekaṃ niḥsaṃdhibandharūpatvena🔽bhinnaṃ ca avayavalakṣaṇaikadeśadvāreṇa svīkurvate /
